inn1.comm: flighted on off stump, easily pushed to long-on
just a bit too short and Dhawan waited on it nicely before tapping it between point and cover. Lovely footwork to use the depth of the crease
this one is on a length but doesn't offer any room. Dhawan is back and blocks
pushed through on middle and leg, Dhawan defends from the crease
a bit of flight on off stump draws him forward to defend
lunges forward to reach the pitch and blocks with hard hands
128 kph, angles a fuller delivery on the pads and Rohit eases it to the left of midwicket. Neatly placed
129kph, lovely! Didn't have much heat on this, but this bouncer sails over shoulder-height around the off stump. Dhawan has seen it early and sways away
and the fuller one to follow, Dhawan inches forward and digs it out to mid-off
fullish, but his radar is generous. Too wide outside off and Dhawan's slashing blade cannot reach it
134 kph, good length ball on off stump, Dhawan comes forward to defend into the covers

pierces the covers and this is a very quick outfield. Wasn't a half-volley by any means but with the new ball, this is a gorgeously paced pitch and Dhawan has planted his front leg and just hit through the line
angles it wide outside off, not bothered with
slows it and tosses it up on off stump, Rohit goes forward and blocks
chips down the track to smother any hope of turn and opens the face on impact. Excellent work with both hands and feet as Rohit tucks himself into a boundary over extra cover
flighted on the pads, pushed down to long-on.
drifting on the pads and Dhawan whips it through towards the midwicket boundary. Three men are after it and deep square leg is the first to get to it
strides forward to defend this flighted delivery on off stump

on the back foot and he's rapped on the pads! This was fired in on a good length and there was absolutely no spin on offer. Just skids onto him and beats his hectic flick shot to find him in front of leg stump. Or at least that's what Umpire Nigel Llong thinks. HawkEye says it would have clipped
131 kph, Fullish and angling in on off stump, eased to square leg
132kph, back of a length on off stump, but still he inches forward and blocks down the pitch
fullish on off stump, strides forward to defend to mid-on
short and wide down the leg side. Rohit wants nothing to do with it
fullish on middle and leg, picks it away to square leg without much footwork
take that! Short and outside off, doesn't bounce enough to trouble the batsman. Shifts his balance onto his back foot and pulls it powerfully over square leg
good length ball just outside off, Rohit is forward and across and blocks by his feet
136kph, starts off targeting his pads with a full delivery and Kohli picks it away to long leg
good length ball probing in the channel, Rohit lazily walks into an on-the-up drive and guides it to point
fullish and outside off, Rohit comes forward and pushes to mid-off
too much width there and he gets on top of the bounce and carves this away behind point. Seems a very easy-paced wicket with pace on the ball and he uses that to supreme advantage
much better. Tightens his line on middle and off and forces Rohit to block
fullish and angled across him, Rohit unleashes a very fluid cover drive. Can't beat the field though. Think that went off the bottom of his bat
fullish and targeting off stump, but Kohli's defensive blade is good enough to keep this out
pulls the bottom hand off the bat as he turns this good length ball towards midwicket. Perhaps there was a bit more bounce than Kohli expected there
good stride forward and blocks this fullish delivery outside off
opens the face to guide this good length ball outside off down to deep third man.
nice and tight on middle and off, but Rohit is on the back foot and nudges towards square leg
pokes outside the off stump, but there isn't much movement on offer to make batsmen think twice about that stroke. Back of a length delivery, eased to deep third man
fullish on off stump, presents half a face to steer it to point
absolutely no timing there and that might well be what saves him. Has another wander down the track, but this goes right off the bottom of the bat and falls short of mid-on
fullish on off stump, seemed a little early on the stroke there as well. Wanted to hit to mid-off and ends up giving work to the bowler on his followthrough

137 kph, picked away and this has sailed over the boundary rope, that seems to have been pulled in. It was a steady delivery outside off, but Rohit planted his front foot across and dismissed it from his presence.
117 kph, slower ball on the pads, flicked away to the right of the short fine leg fielder. Didn't get it off the middle, but he had found the gap
140kph, sharp pace but it's to the batsman's benefit when you present a length ball  on the pads. Rohit flicks to deep backwards square leg
129 kph, walks at him gets on top of the bounce to push this through the covers. Lovely placement from Kohli

excellent calling from Rohit. This back of a length delivery was angled back in at him and Kohli nudged it into the leg side. The non-striker saw it would take the keeper some time to get it and rushes through
124 kph, worked away through square leg as he allows this shortish ball to come to him and uses his wrists to give it direction
130 kph, lured into playing a drive on the up. That was rather uppish but goes too far square of the man at short cover. Inspects his bat.
fuller and straighter and Kohli's never troubled by this line. Flicked to midwicket
shortish on middle and I think it was a little slower as well. Wanted to whip it though square leg, but gets a bit of a leading edge. Doesn't lob up though

fullish and outside off and allows Rohit to essay a purely magnificent loft over mid-off. Too full from Junaid as he switches around the wicket and a full swing of a straight bat takes the breath of most people away
back of a length, but not enough room to cut. Gets a thick inside edge but it doesn't endanger the stumps much to Rohit;s relief. He hadn't realised how close that was
punched to short cover as this is shortish and outside off
charges at the good length ball angled in at him. Had made a touch of room and whacked it over the bowler's lead. One-bounce four. Looked far more forceful with this shot
shortish on and around off stump, Rohit wanted to pull but then ducked under it
back of a length and outside off, eased towards point

guides it straight into the keeper's hands and Gul is off with his best imitation of Shoaib Akhtar's aeroplane celebration. That is a big wicket and how softly it has fallen. Shortish ball outside off, Kohli tries to guide it away towards third man but gets too fine an edge. Bit more bounce and a touch of seam inward outs Pakistan on top
very full on off stump, met with a straight bat
back of a length and this seems to bounce a little more again. Rahane was on the back foot and tries to nudge to midwicket
135 kph, good length ball on off stump. Defended
fullish and outside off, strides forward and blocks quite well
136 kph, gorgeous! That was nothing more than a defensive push but Rahane's timing combined with this outfield takes this fuller delivery on middle to the straight boundary. Very composed strike
very full delivery, angled in on middle and leg. Eased into the covers as he makes some room
good length ball on the stumps, punched off the back foot
tossed up on off stump, driven into the covers
shortens his length on off stump, pushed to mid-on
too short and Afridi's inherent pace makes this late cut an almost foregone conclusion. Hint of spin away, but Rohit had it covered as he cuts perfectly
flicked through wide mid-on as this was tossed up on off stump
back of a length on off stump, defended
fullish and outside off, should have gone far more forward than he did. But he does play with a straight bat which guides the ball into the off side
shortish and outside off, Rohit shuffled across and flicks in front of square leg. Nicely on top of the bounce there
132 kph, digs one in short and the direction is good too. Rahane realises it's on middle and ducks
bit more bounce on this good length ball as well, Rahane is forward and gets it on the sticker of the bat
back of a length on off stump, Rahane gets in line and pushes to mid-off
some turn for Afridi, but this was shortish and outside off so Rohit is on the back foot and eases it through the covers
drifts in on off stump and turns away. Rahane was to the pitch of it as he defends
flighted outside off, Rahane pushes back to the bowler
lunges forward to try and sneak a single into the covers but he hasn't hit it a soft as he thought
pulls his length back and this slides down leg, Rahane flicks but straight to short fine leg
tossed up on leg stump, nudged through to deep square leg
130 kph, very full and angled in at him. Strikes Rahane on the pads as he was going to flick. Very optimistic appeal from Talha because this was slipping way down leg stump
fullish and on the stumps, Rohit works it towards midwicket
137 kph, back of a length and on the pads, picked away to long leg
width outside off but he can't capitalise. He's on the front foot and tries to hit on the up, but his timing deserts him
Oops, he strayed in line with a short ball down leg and as Anand pointed out in the last over, the boundaries are short there and this pull shot is only gloved but it just races away.
140kph, back of a length outside off, stands up tall to defend to mid-off
flayed through the covers and he brings up another eye-catching fifty. Too much flight and far too much room from Afridi and Rohit does not hold back
fullish and tucks him up on middle and leg, nudged wide of mid-on
tossed up outside off, Rahane is forward and opens the face to send the ball to deep point
flighted on off stump, pushed into the covers with an angled bat
short and wide, cut to the sweeper
length ball on middle and leg, short midwicket dives over this push off the back foot
138kph, back of a length on off stump, gets it more off the inside half of the bat as he finds midwicket
fullish on middle and off, comes nicely forward and blocks into the covers
dug in, but Rahane wasn't too troubled by it. Swivels on the back foot and pulls to deep square leg
good length ball on off stump, Rohit is on the back foot and nudges to midwicket. Struck rather high on the bat there
138kph, slammed it into the middle of the pitch and that jagged away too far outside off for the batsman to have a chance. Think that hit a crack and took off
139kph, back of a length and outside off, pushed into the covers
139kph, fullish and just outside off, Rohit presents an open face to find cover. That will be drinks
flighted on off stump, defended with bat in front of pad
gets forward to this tossed up offspinner outside off and nudges to midwicket
tossed up on off, solid forward defensive from Rahane as he keeps bat and pad together
strays in length as this is short and wide, Rahane rocks back and cuts to the sweeper
think that was the doosra. Lovely flight on off stump, but Rohit seems to have picked it as he defends with an open face
nudged down the pitch as he lunges forward to the flighted delivery outside off
shortish and outside off, think he was looking to force it through the off side but the extra bounce deceives him. Lobs up off the bat but there is no one close in to take advantage.
141kph, ducks back off the pitch as this is fuller. Rahane was looking to whip it through the leg side and gets an inside edge onto his pads
there's his timing. Length ball on off stump screams away to deep square leg as Rahane employs some impressive wrist work
short and wide outside off, Rahane goes for the pull but there is protection in the deep
back of a length and outside off, Rohit stands up tall and punches this on top of its bounce to deep point
139kph, hint of width outside off as Rahane steers this confidently into the hands of point
holds his length back which allows the batsman to go deep in the crease and punch in front of point
skips down the track, but again Ajmal pulls his length back and gets this to turn nicely. Rahane adjusts and pushes down to long-on
quicker and flatter, and yet he gets appreciable turn. Clipped to short fine leg
tossed up on off stump, Rohit was worried about the doosra and reads this off the pitch. Hurried into a defensive push
slower and flighted on middle and leg, eased in front of square on the leg side
goes back to the length ball on off stump, but can only push it back to the bowler

almost a collision again as three fielders crowd under this. But Hafeez is the one who pulls off a blinder! This was short and outside off and prompts Rohit to go for a pull. Only he gets a top-edge, another sign of this pitch slowing down, and the ball goes straight up. Hafeez was running back and had to make some ground too, deep square leg was running in and they suffer glancing blows, but not before Hafeez completes a lovely grab. First wicket in ODIs for Talha
back of a length and outside off. Punched into the covers
136kph, short ball outside off. Left alone
punched into the covers as this is shortish and outside off
137 kph, Almost another one there as Rahane pushes with hard hands. This was back of a length and seemed to have held up on the pitch again. Falls just short of the bowler in his followthrough
lovely teasing line from Ajmal outside off as the batsman shuffles across and blocks with soft hands.
skips down the track to nudge this flighted delivery on off stump to long-on

loopy delivery from Ajmal almost results in a wicket. He had slowed this up considerably and Rahane was almost through with the shot by the time it arrived. Goes off the face, onto pad and evades the keeper rushing forward
doosra outside off. Did not pick it as he was looking to work it away through midwicket. Beaten comfortably and the keeper asks for a stumping. Rahane did not move his back foot one bit. Safe
good length ball on and around off stump, kept out
flighted outside off, strides forward to defend
back of a length and outside off, dabbed into the off side and they race through. Good play
140 kph, leans into a cover drive as this is fullish and outside off
135 kph, good bouncer as Rahane fetches it from outside off. Did well to roll his wrists and keep it down. But that is still a risky shot
142ph, too wide outside off and it's called as much
fullish and outside off, carefully left alone
back of a length and just outside off, Rayudu was looking for a quick single again but point had swooped down on this too soon
140kph, dug in outside off and Rayudu is not too keen to offer a shot
tossed up on off stump, plays with the turn and clips to short fine leg
lovely flight from Ajmal and the batsman sees it. Chips down the track and nudges to long-on. Slip and short leg crowd the new batsman
tossed up outside off, Rahane's tentative on the front foot. Blocked after reading it off the pitch
that's a terrific shot! Skipped down the track and thumps it through extra cover. Hit against the turn, but he had reached the pitch and his timing is sublime
flighted on off stump, nudged to square leg
flighted on off stump, strides forward and blocks with bat in front of pad
short and affords a lot of room too and he goes back and cuts behind point. Didn't time it too well though

a wristy little flick but he's picked out midwicket! It was a length ball outside off, should have been punched down the ground for a single but he was moving across and was trying to manufacture a stroke. Chips it in the air and midwicket leaps up and takes it over his head. Sharp catch, simply done
starts off with a short ball just a shade outside off. Karthik sinks to his knees and sways out of the way in exaggerated fashion
138kph, fullish and outside off, comes forward and steered behind point
good length ball outside off stump, Rayudu makes use of what little room is there and guides it to deep third man
full and outside off, DK eases into a drive to mid-off
turns into him, but it's slow so Rayudu has time to rock back and make a little room before punching this through the covers

doesn't pick the doosra there, but he does succeed in playing with soft hands and guiding this past the lone slip fielder. This is his first time facing Ajmal and Rayudu isn't inspiring too much confidence
skips down the track and works this flighted delivery to deep midwicket
tossed up on off stump, lunges forward to defend with bat and pad close together
goes on with the arm, but the length was short. Karthik is deep in his crease and cuts in front of point

rips past the outside edge as Rayudu pokes outside off! Told you his doosra was going to be even more difficult to face from around the wicket. Lovely length too where the batsman doesn't know whether to go forward or back
fullish and outside off, defended safely
confident push forward to defend this fuller delivery outside off
140kph, digs it in outside off and DK sways inside the line
back of a length and outside off, left alone
135kph, doesn't like the batsman chipping down the track and shortens his length again. Rising towards his chest and DK did well to get on top of the bounce and nudge it towards midwicket

deep third man is there, but the upper cut is placed fine of him. Swayed inside the line and with a whip of his wrists he sends this off to the boundary. But it was looking dangerous when the ball was hit in the air
135kph, ripper straight up! Good length ball angled in, but it straightens off the deck. That's a Junaid  special and DK doesn't know too much about it as he pushes with an open face
fullish on off stump, strides forward to defend with a straight bat this time
fired in on middle and off, Rayudu was in front of all three stumps while trying combat the one that moves away. Nudges towards mid-on
nicely struck, even if he was playing away from his body. Length ball with a bit of width, steered to deep cover
good shot, he's far more comfortable against pace as this is steered behind point. Just a little too much room from Junaid as he goes back over the wicket
beaten off another feeble poke outside off. The single to third man is just too tempting
nice and tight on middle, DK is on the back foot and blocks
oh, that was far too close to off stump to attempt a late cut. DK adjusts at the last minute and employs a straighter bat to nudge to short third man
worked towards the left of short fine leg
tossed up and angling in on middle and leg, finds short fine this time
short and wide outside off, cut to deep point
skips down the track and flicks towards short midwicket. Hafeez dives to his left but the ball bounces short of him
fullish and angled in on off stump, DK's straight bat is good enough
shortish and outside off, dabbed down to deep third man

oh dear, Rayudu hesitated on this quick single and finds point to be quite obliging as he doesn't field the ball properly. This was fullish and fired in on of stump, defended with an open face and DK knew there was a single straight away. Rayudu though was a little sluggish to respond
fullish on off stump, defended off the front foot
fired in full on middle and off, DK presents a straight bat in search of another quick single, but midwicket and mid-on are too quick
138kph, back of a length and outside off, steered to backward point
goes down the track as he saw this tossed up, almost yorks himself as this is pushed to long-on
pitched a bit short and there was some turn on offer too! DK waits on the back foot and cuts fine of the sweeper
flighted on off stump, defended off the front foot
thought he would outfox the batsman charging at him by firing it full and down the leg side. DK puts bat to it though and flicks to deep square leg
length ball on middle and leg, punched towards the left of midwicket
hurries him into a nudged to midwicket
129kph, short ball sails over a ducking DK, but it was down the leg side
shortish and outside off, Rayudu was lured into poking as this straightens off the deck. Terrific delivery again from Junaid
141kph, length ball on middle and leg, worked away towards midwicket
full and outside off, DK gets a thick inside edge through to deep square leg
131kph, fullish on leg stump, Rayudu blocks on the front foot and because he played with soft hands this goes behind square on the leg side
good length ball on middle and off, DK was looking to whip it through midwicket and gets a thick outside edge to deep third man. Reverse swing, boys and girls
fullish and just outside off, defended
flighted outside off, pushed into the covers
too quick for that shot to go where it was intended. Shortish and outside off, DK set up for the pull but has to settle for a jab to long-on
goes down the track and punches to long-on
another little foray down the pitch, this time from DK, as he eases this off his boots
shortens his length as Rayudu comes down the track, but it only sits up for him to punch to long-off
tossed up outside off, lunges forward to defend
this ducks back in quite sharply as the batsman was going back to try and work away through midwicket. Had to adjust his stroke and present a straighter bat. DK was anxious for a non-existant single
punched to long-on as he shortens the length to prevent the batsman coming down the track
worked away behind square leg as he waits for the ball to turn
good length ball just outside off, defended
chips down the track, but Hafeez pulls the length back and keeps him to a defensive push
full on leg stump, whipped to midwicket

pushed through on middle and leg, DK was charging at him and gets struck on the pads. Afridi goes up in appeal, but considering the distance that ball had to travel this is a good decision. HawkEyes says it would have clipped the top of leg
quicker and flatter outside off. Opened the face to guide it to short third man
tossed up on off stump, defended off the front foot

hesitation in the running again! This time DK had called for it and then almost had second thoughts. Found the gap in the cover field and Rayudu's response was quick enough. In the end he pulls out a desperate dive and makes it
nudged towards midwicket
this was the straighter one outside off, DK was coming forward and gets an outside edge towards point
flighted on off stump, lunges forward to block
good work by the bowler as, first, he shortens his length after seeing the batsman charge him. Rayudu is forced to push to mid-on, but Hafeez dives to his right and keeps it to none
good length ball, turning sharply into him. Goes back and clips through midwkcet
tossed up on off stump, defended off the front foot
good flight again from Hafeez, but the forward defence is just about solid enough
tossed up on leg stump, nudged away through square leg
restrictive line from Ajmal as this dribbles off the thigh pad down towards long leg
good flight on leg stump, pushed straight to square leg
he's seen enough of this line, premeditated the sweep and even though Ajmal shortened his length, DK's large stride down the track helps him go through with the stroke
flighted on leg, eased away behind square
flighted on off stump, he was looking to flick it into the leg side. Didn't pick the doosra and the leading edge goes to mid-off

he has lobbed it straight into the hands of short fine leg! Another premeditated sweep, but this time he gets a top edge and Ajmal tumbles to his right to pick up a good low catch. Needless stroke to a good length ball on off stump
flighted on off stump, strides forward to defend
not too much flight on this, considering it is the powerplay. Defended on middle
nudged to midwicket as he attacks middle stump
flighted outside off, opens the face to steer in front of point
loopy offspinner outside off lures the batsman forward to block
not too much flight there as Jaddu goes forward to push towards point. Wants the single, but there's nothing there
oh, ripper! Tosses it up just a bit more and this grips in the pitch. Turns right across the left-hander's poke outside off
shuffles across as this is shortish and he dabs very fine to the third man boundary. Excellently placed.
turned away to midwicket as he strides out to the pitch of the ball
comes forward and finds midwicket again
this time he waits just a tad bit more and nurdles the tossed up delivery on middle through square leg
carves this length ball from off stump away in front of point
flatter delivery going straight on. Rayudu charges him and pushes into the covers
waits on the front foot for this length ball to turn and works it away to midwicket
lovely chip over midwicket! Ensured he hit it over the man inside the circle and it was too wide for long-on to pull back. Great use of his feet

this one keeps low as it skids along with the arm. Jaddu had not picked it and the Pakistan players are convinced they have their man as he is struck very low on the pads in front of leg stump. Umpire Llong thinks it would have gone down and then walks up to Hafeez to talk about overappealing. HawkEye thinks this would have hit leg though!
flighted on off stump, defended
shortish and outside off, goes back and punches into the covers. Rayudu had to motor as the fielder has a shy at the stumps. The dive saves him, but he seems to have injured his leg
bit of turn outside off as this is quick and flat. Defended into the covers
driven into the covers as this is sent down with a bit more flight
gets a bit more bounce than Jaddu expects and he wears this on the thigh while looking to flick
lunges forward to defend the flighted delivery outside off and so ends the batting powerplay that has yielded 21 runs and a wicket
just short enough for him to go back and dab towards backward point
makes room outside leg and slaps this shortish ball to sweeper
skips down the track as he flicks this flighted delivery on off stump to midwicket
lunges forward and sweeps away to long leg
flighted on off stump, defended to cover
short and wide, cut quite crisply through point but there is protection in the deep
shortish and Jaddu make some room to cut  to deep third man
comes down the track to flick through midwicket
too straight with this length ball and Jaddu pulls to deep square leg
slammed over deep midwicket! Excellent use of the feet and this time his intent matches as he swings this flighted delivery over the boundary
pushed down the ground to long-on
full and on the pads, Jaddu would be displeased at finding the lone man at short fine leg
negotiates the turn rather well as he waits for it and flicks to deep midwicket. Sluggish work from the man as the batsmen sneak a couple
worked away to deep square leg as he rides the turn on this fuller delivery
skids on with the arm and Jaddu's late cut makes contact just in time. No run to point
slogged to midwicket, but a diving effort from Afridi keeps it to none. Had to run across to his left and keeps it t a single
tossed up on off stump, pushed to long-on to bring up his second ODI fifty. India needed a batsman to stay in there and he has done that. But now he has to push on

he's almost giftwrapped his wicket to Pakistan but Hafeez drops a sitter! Goes for a slog sweep, but his swing across the line of this flighted delivery on middle ensures he only gets a top edge. Hafeez calls for it and settles under it, but the ball just pops out of his hands. Couldn't even catch it on the second attempt
full and wide outside off, driven on the up into the covers

short and wide, thwacked over point! He's looked comfortable against pace all through this innings and this time, though his weight was moving forward, he was on top of the bounce and has placed it well
back of a length and it jags back on off stump, defended with soft hands
lets this shortish delivery on off stump come to him and lets it slide off the open face towards deep third man
skips down the track and drives to mid-off. Ran with the shot and completes the single
calls for two, but Rayudu is not up for it. This was a length ball on off stump, Jaddu waits for it and flicks wide of long-on
turn and bounce for Hafeez! This was flighted outside off and the batsman was pushing, gets it off the shoulder towards the off side
skips down the track, but he fires it full and flat outside off. Dabbed to point
nudges through to the square leg boundary as he works the angle into him
tossed up on off stump, he races down the track and goes for a rank slog across the line. Thick inside edge to deep midwicket
short ball with some room outside off, Jaddu is camped on the back foot and pulls straight to mid-on
he's found the gap in front of point this time! Bit of room outside off and he has cracked that away to bring up India's 200
fullish and angled in at him, Rayudu jabs to point and runs
too close to the off stump for that shot. Excellent length from Gul and this jags away from him quite late. Jaddu tries to run it down to third man, but cannot get bat to ball
goes down the track but Gul digs it in short. Goes through with the pull and hustles across for a couple. Maqsood throws to the bowler's end, but Jaddu was struggling at the keeper's end
that's bludgeoned down the ground! Bowler-killer from Jaddu as he clears his front leg and pummels a full-length ball straight down the ground. Gul does well to just duck under it
another missile, this through midwicket! It was short and on middle and leg. Jaddu rocked back and pulls well past the only man there in the deep
slower ball angled across him as Jaddu guides to point who is on the edge of the circle
gets a flatter delivery to turn outside off, Jaddu is on the back foot and nudges towards midwicket

makes ample room for himself as he charges Ajmal, but he hasn't got hold of it. It was the doosra from Ajmal, which also pushed the ball away from him and foil his timing. The bat turns in his hand as this gains more height than distance and long-on runs to his left to pouch it safely
pushed through on off stump and limits Jaddu to a defensive push to point
now that's how you middle it! Loves crearing that front leg and he's smeared this fuller delivery on off stump over midwicket boundary. Hit with the turn as this was the doosra
shortens his length and hastens the pace of this delivery, Jaddu pushes towards mid-on
keeps it nice and tight on middle and Ashwin is happy to keep it out.
low full toss on middle and leg, whipped away into the leg side for a quick single

he has feathered it through to the keeper, but the ump's not spotted that! This was a back of a length delivery just outside off, Ashwin was looking to guide it through to third man, rather like how Kohli got out, only this time Oxenford has not spotted the deviation
goes deep in his crease and slogs this length ball through midwicket. This was off a thick inside edge, but once he beat the fielder inside the circle, the outfield took care of the rest
short ball just a touch outside off, Ashwin goes for a hook and gets a top edge which sails over the keeper! Ashwin cashing in big time!
makes some room outside leg to thump this very full delivery on leg stump to mid-off
creamed over midwicket! Length from Gul again! He's being derailed here as Jadeja ensures his front leg is out of the way and pummels it over the boundary. What a strike!
goes for a reverse sweep and is made a fool off by the Ajmal doosra

another doosra as he spots Ashwin racing down the wicket. Tries to slog it over midwicket like Jaddu is so easily doing, but his bat is nowhere near the ball. Akmal waits for just a bit, as if taunting the batsman, so far had he gone down the track, and is stumped

total confusion off Shami's first ball. Its a length ball that slides off his thigh pad. Shami wants the run first but Jaddu is not interested, then sets off but this time it's Shami who sends him back
flighted and it turns the other way, pokes outside off and is beaten
another wicket as Shami goes for an awful slog! It was flighted and invited the tail-ender for a big hit. Simple top-edge that is pouched at deep midwicket
102kph, fires a good length ball on middle and leg, Jaddu works it to midwicket. One runs and two wickets in the 49th over! Ajmal, you beauty!
very full on middle, Jaddu drags it wide of long-on for a couple as the fielders fumble
hip-high full toss which is pulled to long leg. He needs to get two and he was struggling, but the throw is poor. That's Jaddu's fifty and he raises both hands high in the air and punches his fist.
low full toss on off stump, thumped to deep midwicket for a single. Mishra on strike now
wide yorker and he jams an open face down to steer to point on the edge of the circle
what a ball from Junaid! It was the short ball on off stump and Jaddu, who was hoping it would sail over his head, leaves it alone. He was completely surprised by that choice of length
hip-high full toss again as Jaddu swings as hard as he could. It drops short of midwicket and Jaddu was looking for a second, but Mishra refuses

inn2.comm: excellent timing off the very first ball he faces. Sharjeel looks in no trouble out there despite his tumble in the first innings. Shuffles across and cuts this back of a length delivery outside off to deep third man
goes fuller and this swings in at him, but he started it on the pads and it moves further down the leg side.
fullish and ducks in after pitching. Defended off the front foot
fullish and attacks the stumps. A hint of swing in there as well and it helps Shehzad who flicks to the long leg boundary. Had shuffled across to the off side to get it quite fine
continues moving around at the crease as he whips it away to deep square leg
fullish and it curls into him on middle, pushed to mid-on
gets this length ball to shape away as Sharjeel blocks from the crease. Outside edge to point
fullish on middle, with a hint of shape away. Defended without too much feet movement
good length ball on middle and leg, worked to midwicket

thuds into the ground and just keeps picking up pace to the point boundary! What timing! Bit of room outside off and he steers it behind point, but the first bounce was on the adjacent pitch and it just races away
138 kph, length ball with room outside off again. Carves it to the right of point where Rahane pulls of a diving stop
good length ball on off stump, gets in line and defended off the back foot
picked away off middle stump. Shehzad's timing is on display again as this almost reaches the boundary.
fullish on and around off stump, defended into the covers
129kph, bit of swing on this fuller delivery outside off, Sharjeel drives to cover
pushes from his crease with an angled bat as this length ball is pushed to short point
good length ball probing away in the channel, Sharjeel punches into the covers

beats the off side ring with a slash! Just a little too much room there and he throws his bat at it. Short point dives to his left, but can't get anything behind it. Cover and point just usher it to the boundary
length ball on off stump, defended
back of a length on off stump, blocked
front-foot punch in front of point as this is shortish and outside off
length ball on off stump, pushed into the covers off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, stays back and pushes to mid-on
full on middle, shuffles across and drives with a straight bat to mid-on
135 kph, short ball with a bit of room outside off. That's all the leverage he needs to rock back and pull to the square leg boundary. Authoritative stroke!
length ball angled in on off stump, cut away to deep cover

that is an absolute peach! India go up for the caught behind, but umpire Oxenford does not think there is an edge and what a good decision that is! Good length ball angled in and jags away. Shehzad was squared up as he tries to defend and it's flicked the back pad on its way to the keeper
137kph, more away movement and this time it is off back of a length. Edged behind point
138 kph, full and wide outside off. Carted to mid-on. Doesn't carry to the felder
back of a length and just outside off, punched to point
full and slides down leg side. Sharjeel was looking to tickle it away, but doesn't succeed
fullish on off stump, defended to short point
good length ball on off stump, kept out
fullish on off stump, walks into a drive to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, picks it away off his hips as he shuffles across. Long leg has a bit of work to do
full on middle, Sharjeel's footwork is non-existant as he hacks this through square leg. Races across for a couple
shortish on middle, Sharjeel goes for a one-legged pull but it scurries under the bat, hits his thigh and goes off to the third man boundary.

138kph, on the pads again and it's a short boundary behind the pitch. Length ball would have been perfect for the right-hander, but it's Sharjeel on strike. Runs off the front pad and Shami's pace carries it through. His problems against left-handers continue
good length ball moving away outside off, left alone

overpitched on off stump and Shehzad takes advantage with a straight bat. He's looking for some swing by keeping the ball up to the bat. This time though it assists the batsman as he beats mid-off on his right
good length ball on off stump, defended
slides in off a fuller length, clipped to long leg
shovels it over mid-on! It was on a length and he is always fond of those pick-up strokes on the leg side. Great whip of the wrists to instill power into the stroke
slides down the leg side with a length ball. Sharjeel doesn't connect with a flick
inside edge, but it hits his pads and wanders through towards point! Length ball a bit too close to cut, but Sharjeel disagrees. Could have been close there
back of a length on off stump, dabbed towards mid-on with soft hands and they rush through for a single.
143kph, fullish on off stump, defended as he moved half-forward
launched into the stands at midwikcet! Just short but Sharjeel was waiting on the back foot and thumps it. Short-armed pull to perfection
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler, quite strongly too
carted to the midwicket boundary again as Shami persists with short-pitched stuff. Terrible ball on a slow pitch
length ball sliding across the left-hander, punched to point
good length ball leg stump, defended
flighted on leg stump, Shehzad is quick on the sweep. Gets a decent bat on it and short fine leg does quite well to keep it inside the field of play
shuffles across to defend this length ball to midwicket
he's on off stump by the time he defends this length ball on off stump
flighted outside off, leans into a cover drive
flighted on off stump, goes forward to block back to the bowler
slows it up and tosses it on middle, Sharjeel comes forward to block
hint of turn as this is on off stump and turning into middle. Defended
pushed in front of point as he flights it outside off, bit of hesitation but all's well that ends well for Pakistan

skips down the track and Jaddu pulls his length back. Shehzad hits straight to short cover and the fielder hurts it at the stumps. Dead-eye throw from Rahane, but the batsman had rushed back in just in time.
short ball outside off, slapped through the covers. Beats the man catching, then the one at the edge of the circle. Pin-point placement
drags it short again and this time Shehzad waits for it a little more and cuts behind point. Even India's spinners are leaking runs
tossed up outside off, carved through the covers. But there is protection in the deep
flighted outside off, eased through point off the front foot
lots of flight on middle stump, pushed down towards long-off but Ashwin rushes across and dives to stop the single
lofts him over extra cover as this was tossed up on off stump. Angled bat used to good advantage
shortish and just outside off, punched through to deep cover

carrom ball sneaks through bat and pad off the intended cover drive! The turn on that was vastly impressive, almost like a leggie! Very loose stroke from Sharjeel as his front foot hardly moved  and he just went at the ball with his hands
tossed up on off stump, gets down the track and drives to long-off
slides on with the arm, as this fuller delivery is turned down towards fine leg
short ball with a hint of width, rocks back and cut to the sweeper
magnificent strike from Hafeez! Second ball in and he charges the spinner, reaches the pitch and lofts him clean over long-on
tossed up on leg stump, turned away through square leg
bit of turn outside off as this is tossed up outside off. Defended off an open face
good flight on middle stump. Shehzad blocks off the front foot after reading it off the pitch
this time turns sharply! Gorgeous flight and dip from Mishi! Angled in and turns right across the outside edge of Shehzad's front foot push
goes back to counter the turn even as this is on a good length on the stumps. Driven to long-on
touch of turn to this good length ball on the stumps, whipped to mid-on
another ripping legspinner! Hafeez was ready to pull it, but this bounces and turns a little too much for the batsman's liking. Settles for keeping it out
tossed up on off stump, kept out. What a fine over from Mishi, after being the perennial traveler
tossed up on off stump, lap-swept towards the long leg boundary. He knows that area is unmanned and deep backward square leg has a lot of work to do
length ball that goes on with the arm. That's a Jaddu special and he goes up in appeal, only there was a bit of inside edge before it hit the front pad
length ball on middle, goes back and punches into the covers. A bit of misfield by both Jaddu who raced after it
not too keen on flighting it, pushed down the ground to long-on
clipped to the left of midwicket as he waits on this length ball that slides into him
flighted on the pads, easily worked to deep square leg
keeps low as this is on middle! Everything is happening when the ball is with Mishi! Just about kept out by Hafeez as he flicks to mid-on.
goes wide of the crease and tosses it up on off stump, lures the batsman forward into a defensive off the inside edge
teasing flight outside off drags the batsman forward with an open face. Outside edge runs away past the slip fielder
angled in on leg and it turns away, Hafeez is back and clips to midwicket
tossed up on off stump, nudged into the covers. Lovely soft hands from Hafeez as he sneaks a single
slides this quicker delivery down the leg side. Shehzad waits for it to turn, but there is very little on offer.

short ball and he's pulled it straight to short midwicket! Shehzad is stunned, India have wry smiles on their faces. Possibly his worst delivery in this spell, but those rippers he produced before must have played on the mind of the batsman.
length ball angled in, Hafeez clips through to deep square leg
length ball skids onto the bat, which is offered at an angle. Nicely guided to third man for a single
back of a length on a leg-stump line from Shami, goes off the thigh pad and through square leg
136kph, you beauty! This just short of a good length ball holds its line just outside off and Misbah's poke is to no avail
shuffles right across on off stump and blocks into the covers
fullish on off stump, pushes into the covers off the front foot
tossed up on off stump, Hafeez prefers to defend off the back foot

complete confusion and Misbah's gone to a run-out again! This was tossed up and doesn't turn, blocked into the covers and takes off for the single. But half-way through he changes his mind and sells his captain a dummy. The throw is a little off and Mishi does extremely well taking it low to his left, dives towards the stumps on his right and underarms to break the stumps!
tossed up on off stump, driven to short cover
yorker on middle stump, dug out
whipped through to deep midwicket. This wasn't quite short enough, but those wrists are employed to great effect as he picks it away off the back foot
slowed it up and teases him outside off, played with an angled face to point
good length ball on off stump, poked into the covers
tossed up on off stump, goes forward to defend
nice and tight on off stump, Hafeez keeps it out. He's decided to drop anchoe, I think
flighted on off stump, defended with bat and pad close together
chips down the track and drives through extra cover. Good, controlled stroke
attacks middle with a fullish delivery, blocked with bat in front of pad
tossed up on leg stump, Hafeez turns it towards midwicket. It lobs up but there is no one close in
74kph, slows it up and this has a lovely loop to it! Pitches on middle and turns clear past his outside edge
tossed up on off stump, lunges forward to defend
googly this time, but Akmal's picked it and nudges to square leg
goes wide of the crease and guides it with an angled face to short third man
quicker, flighted one on middle, kept out

bit of turn for Jadeja as this is flat and full on off stump. Lures Hafeez into a lazy drive on the up and gets a thick outside edge which wanders away to the third man boundary. Just pulled back inside
goes on with the arm and Akmal pushes down the ground with a straight bat
short with a bit of width, Hafeez is quick on the back foot and cuts in front of point. His darts are not working
fullish and flat on middle and off, defended
sliding down leg, clipped behind the square leg ump
nicely worked as he opens the face to use the width on this fuller delivery to find the sweeper
total loss in radar there as the googly goes short and slides down leg. Akmal could have let it go and taken a wide, but he goes for a pull and wears it
tossed up on off stump, driven back to the bowler
a bit short and just jags away off the pitch. Akmal makes a late decision to cut, and it only goes as far as the first slip
tossed up outside off, pushed down to long-off
punched into the covers as this is flighted on off stump
flighted on off stump, eased into the covers again
a wide yorker to start with, jabs at it but doesn't connect
looped up outside off, driven through the covers
flighted on off stump, pushed to mid-off
Rahane is too good at point. Took a special effort to stop this shot. Goes back and makes some room and cuts this extremely well. But Rahane dives to his right and pulls off a stunning stop
good length ball on middle and leg, nudged to square leg
tossed up on middle and leg, defended
slides the tossed up delivery down leg and it runs off the front pad towards short fine leg

Jaddu has pulled off an amazing skier and Mishi's dream run today continues! Akmal has to walk back after a poor shot! This was tossed up and Akmal could not resist throwing his bat at it. Gets a toe-ender which soars up high into the cover region. Jadeja runs back and takes a blinder over his shoulder. Made it look so simple.
flighted on off stump, defended
flighted on off stump, driven to mid-off
tossed up on leg stump, nudged wide of mid-on
this is the googly and he has not picked it! Was very late in trying to whip it. No bat involved but DK flies in from behind the wicket to take the grab, just in case there was
waits for it and guides behind point for a single
length ball outside off, pushed into the covers
driven to long-off as Jaddu persists with a flatter trajectory
slower and tossed up on middle, defended off the front foot
flighted down leg as he goes for a sweep. Think it went off the glove and very fine. Almost through the keeper's legs. But not quite
length ball on middle and leg, kept out
googly outside off, picked and dragged to deep midwicket
shortish on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg for a couple
this was the googly as well, pitched on middle and cramps him up. Defended into midwicket
waits for it to turn outside off and clips to deep midwicket with a whip of his wrists
flighted on off stump, Maqsood is a little tentative in defence
bit of room outside off, punched through to deep cover
tossed up on off stump, driven down to long-on
tossed up on off stump, and this was slower through the air. Defended down the pitch
flighted on middle and off, lunges forward to block
there's the problem with the leg-stump line. A solid sweep shot can always hurt you. Plus there is no one there on the boundary. Excellent shot from Hafeez
tossed up on leg stump as he goes forward to nudge it to square leg. Huge leg before appeal from Ashwin, but that had taken the inside edge before hitting the front pad
tossed up on middle and leg, defended
length ball turns into him, Maqsood whips to deep midwicket
flighted on leg stump, swept away to deep backward square leg
lovely, loopy delivery on middle and leg. Keeps the batsman to a forward defensive
flighted on leg stump and there's a bit of turn on offer. Squares up the batsman as he lunges forward to defend
quicker and flatter on off stump, defended off an outside edge
too full to cut, which is exactly the shot he goes for. Turns past the edge
tossed up on off stump and it seemed to skid on. Hafeez's bat comes down on it just in time
flighted on off stump, defended off the front foot
on the pads and easily worked between square leg and short fine leg
tossed up on off stump, pushed to mid-on who parries it towards long-off
flighted on off stump, lunges forward to defend through the vacant square leg region
flighted on middle and leg, punched to midwicket
hint of turn outside off as Hafeez is on the back foot and is not too comfortable while defending. His feet were going down leg and his hands were poking outside off
punched off the back foot into the covers as he is better prepared for this length ball outside off
pushed towards silly mid-off
beats backward point as he opens the face and slices at this tossed up delivery outside off stump
lunges forward and presents an angled back to this length ball outside off
driven into the covers as this is a fuller delivery with a bit of room
flighted on the pads, flicked through square leg
shortish and just outside off, punched down the ground. Mid-on rushes across and dives to keep him on strike
length ball, clipped to midwicket
carrom ball from Ashwin, but it's been picked! Flayed over the top of cover. That's a terrific strike. Loads of power from Maqsood
tosses it up outside off, defended into the covers
length ball on middle and off, turned away into the leg side
back of a length outside off, punched with an angled bat into the covers
slower ball on off stump, Hafeez is almost deceived but he adjusts well and blocks down the pitch
short ball outside off, pulls it a little too early as he bottom-edges it through midwicket

great cricket, except from the bowler. It was short and wide and Maqsood has hit one of the crispest strokes of his past handful of innings. But Rahane at point dives to his left and saves a certain boundary
back of a length on off stump, defended with an angled bat. Wanted a single, but he is sent back. It was Rahane who rushes in and underarms a direct throw
137 kph, terrific delivery to end the over. Possibly made better by the batsman's decision to play inside the line with a lame flick. The length ball straightens and beats him comprehensively
fullish on off stump, pushed down towards mid-on
length ball on off stump, blocked off the back foot
good length ball ridden with the little bit of room on offer, but point rushes to his right to stop the single
fullish on off stump, the batsman was a little squared up but still manages to defend
fullish on off stump, pushed back to the bowler. India racking up dot balls
good length ball just outside off, worked to mid-on and he has hit it just a bit wide of the fielder to rush through for a single
shortish and outside off. Hafeez pulls, but the man under our scanner pulls off a diving save at midwicket. Good save from Rohit
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot and Rohit is in action again
slower ball outside off, strides forward to defend down the pitch
length ball on the pads, neatly flicked to deep square leg

the keeper dives full length but he cannot glove this little dab to third man! It was shortish with a bit of room, don't think he wanted to guide it so fine, but it was safe from the keeper and Pakistan pick up a handy four
fullish on off stump, pushed down the ground
good length ball on middle, whipped to short midwicket
slower ball, nice and full on off stump. Hafeez can only defend
fuller and just outside off, Hafeez looks for a punch to mid-off and gets an inside edge onto pad. Cover was vacant and he was lured into the shot
short with a bit of room outside off, slapped to the sweeper
back of a length outside off, punched to long-off
fullish on off stump, driven off the front foot to long-off
length ball outside off, gets forward and punches in front of point. Rahane is impregnable there
picked away off middle stump. That was some lovely timing from Hafeez to reach his fifty. He needs to be there till the end for Pakistan
fullish and outside off, sliced to point off the front foot
just a little short and he climbs into it. Rocks back and pulls, but doesn't find the gap. Walks over towards square leg ump and calms himself down
full and wide outside off, leans forward and drives uppishly through the covers
just short of a good length outside off, Maqsood blocks and players scatter for a drink
tossed up on off stump, kept out
good length ball on the stumps, picked away to mdwicket
turned away square of midwicket and was searching for a single. Maqsood says no
this time they run through for an easy single as he gets forward to nudge the tossed up ball on off stump past midwicket
flighted on off, driven back down the ground. Ashwin dives but only parries it
chips down the track and Ashwin shortens his length. Picked away through midwicket
back of a length on off stump, punched towards mid-on who is rather deep. Nice single
length ball with a bit of room, sliced off the front foot to point
good length ball on off stump, wanted to flick into the leg side but has to settle for the ball going back to the bowler
slower ball on the pads, whipped away with those strong wrists. Hafeez wanted the two, but again Maqsood is not interested

difficult call for the deep square leg fielder and Rohit decides to go for the catch. Great effort diving to his right, and it was the right decision considering how big Hafeez's wicket would have been. But this pick up shot died on him and he can't get his body behind it.
length ball angled in at him, clipped to midwicket on the edge of the circle
length ball on the pads, tucked behind square leg
goes down the track, but he's cramped up. Flicked only as far as midwicket
tossed up on leg stump, clipped to midwicket again. It was a little uppish, but dies well short of the fielder
length ball on leg stump, pushed down the ground

carrom ball and DK's fluffed a stumping! Maqsood was charging down the track and this was excellent bowling as he fires it down leg and out of his reach. It bounces a bit more and was too much for the keeper to collect. Ashwin and Jaddu are distraught! Was that the game?
clipped away to deep midwicket
flighted on leg, eased through midwicket
flighted outside off, sliced to the sweeper off the front foot
flighted on off stump, defended
goes through midwicket! Was this a catch? It was tossed up on leg stump and he looked to swat it away. Doesn't carry to Ashwin who had to dive forward and to his right
quicker and flatter on off stump, blocked rather wristily
flatter delivery on off stump, tries to whip through midwicket but it goes back to the bowler
waits for it to turn and guides this length ball to the left of backward point. Kohli dives and keeps it to one
full and sliding down, clipped away to deep square leg
fullish on off stump, he's across on his front foot and works to midwicket
full on middle and leg, waits for it and clips through midwicket for a couple
good length ball on off stump, with a bit of nibble away. Opens the face to guide to point. Hafeez takes a few steps but Maqsood sends him back
length ball on middle and off, whips through square leg

length ball on middle, Maqsood lofts it towards mid-on. Too deep for it to be caught but Hafeez had hesitated before he set off for the single. Throw at the strikers' would have been interesting, but Rayudu chose the bowlers'. Oh, but wait, if it had hit direct, Maqsood would have been out
hint of turn on off stump and he was playing from the crease. Not at all comfortable against the leggie as this takes the outside edge towards third man
more turn for Mishi! Angles it on just outside off and makes Hafeez poke with an open face. Beaten outside off
this time its too short on middle, rocks back and pulls to deep midwicket
but Maqsood had waited nicely on this length ball to turn and cuts it away behind point.
flatter and quicker on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
googly slides down leg. Too much turn for Maqsood to connect with the flick.
what a timely hit! It's the first boundary off Mishi today as Maqsood takes advantage of the flight and swings away. Doesn't get all of it, but it has enough to sail over the long-on fielder
good length ball on middle and leg, Hafeez goes back and clips into the leg side
tossed up on off stump, defended off the front foot
darted in on off stump as the batsman goes back and pushes into the covers
short and with a bit of room, guided to point off the back foot
tossed up on middle and leg. Nudged towards midwicket
maiden from Jaddu as this is flighted on off stump and the batsman can only block
slower ball outside off, gets forward and drives into the covers. He's predictable with that change in pace

shortish on off stump, Maqsood blocks with soft hands and wanted a single. But Hafeez has spotted Rahane swooping in on it. Good call to say no as he sends in a direct throw. His second of the innings
dug in short on middle and leg, Maqsood jumps up and fends it away behind square on the leg side

short fine leg does extremely well. It's our man Mishi again who dives to his right and gets a good hand to it. It was a length ball on the pads, Hafeez has clipped it rather fine, but not fine enough
137 kph, length ball on middle and off, swiped away over the square leg boundary! Pakistan getting a move on here as Hafeez stands and delivers
full on off stump, pushed to the extra cover fielder
good length ball on off stump, pushed towards mid-on
tossed up on middle and leg, Maqsood muscles it over towards the wide long-on boundary, but there is a fielder there. Excellent move from the captain

swept away, but this is the carrom ball and deep square leg pulls off a catch diving forward! Hitting against the turn there and he has sort of top-edged it. Bhuvi holds his head under pressure and Kohli leaps up and punches the air in delight.
another carrom ball, this one shortish and outside off. Punched back to the bowler
flighted on off stump and he gets the leading edge, but it's a rather meaty one. Sails over the infield and to the man in the deep
another carrom ball as he switches over the wicket. Afridi seems to have picked it as he waits on the back foot and nudges into the covers. Only three runs off that over and a very crucial wicket
length ball on middle and off, goes for a wild sweep and gets struck on the elbow and the ball deflects onto his grille
flighted and angled in at him, whips it in the air but through the vacant midwicket region
flatter delivery on off stump. Pushed to short cover

low full toss, picked away to square leg, but there is some huge confusion out there and Maqsood is run-out! He had timed the flick too well and Afridi recognises that too late. Had rushed forward for the single and then sends his partner back after he had nearly  crossed halfway down the pitch. Ashwin's throw is good and DK does the rest
flighted on off stump, defended off the front foot
googly on off stump, but Gul's picked it and turns it to square leg. Afridi is very twitchy out there. Goes for another single and then has to be send back
full on middle and leg, nudged through midwicket
tossed up on middle and leg, Gul plays the angle as he looks to nudge down to long-on. Gets a leading edge but there is no mid-off
he's dragged it too short and Afridi has slammed it over the midwicket boundary! The ropes have been pulled it so far that this is only a 67m six
little lap sweep goes for a boundary over the keeper's head. Top-edge does it for Afridi and Pakistan and Jaddu's pace on the ball helps them too
tossed up on leg stump, nudged to short fine leg
full dart outside off, leans forward and guides to point with an open face

what a strike! First there was the choice of shot as he goes down on one-knee to sweep him from outside off. Then he has placed it between square leg and short fine and finally is the timing on the stroke, even when he almost pulled his eyes off the ball! Only Afridi can do that
full and outside off, driven into the covers
shortish and outside off, Afridi shuffled across and whips it through midwicket
yorker outside off, Gul was playing inside the line trying to get a little bit of bat and squeeze it down to third man. Misses
length ball, creamed over midwicket! Terribly choice of ball considering the state of the game and Gul says thank you very much as that strong bottom hand takes over
low full toss, lofted over the top of the bowler. Long-on and long-off are too deep and the two batsman know that. Race across for a couple
its the fuller one on middle, clipped through to deep midwicket
another one which is very full on off stump. Gul digs it out to cover. Looks like the plan is clear.
fullish on the stumps but he gets underneath it to whack to long-on
fullish and outside off, shuffles across and whips to long-on
low full toss on off stump, stays in his crease and pushes to long-off with an open face
goes full on leg stump, but Afridi makes room and drills to cover. The India captain dives to his left and stops a certain boundary
wide fuller ball, Gul thumps to long-off
full toss on off stump, whipped through midwicket

Rahane, you little beauty! He's been India's best fielder and at long-off he's snared a blinder! It was in the slot to be smeared over the top, but Gul has hit it off the bottom and Rahane runs to his left and dives forward to pick up a good, low catch
yorker on middle as he makes room outside leg and drills it to cover. Kohli is there and keeps it to none
full and just outside off, Afridi goes down for another sweep and is struck on the pads. Bhuvi goes up in appeal, but the impact was outside the line

caught on the long-off boundary! Bhuvi has taken two in the over and Talha succumbs! It was a length ball on off stump, he made room outside leg to loft him over the top. Gets too much height on this and Jaddu is very composed as he reverse-cups this just inside the boundary

carrom ball and Ajmal's bowled around his legs! Kohli is beside himself, so is Ashwin! This was amazing flight outside leg and lures the tailender into a sweep shot, but this dips on him and turns viciously to take middle stump
anothe carrom ball, but this is short and allows Junaid to get off strike with and little dab towards square leg. Afridi on strike now, with the game on his shoulders
makes room outside off and Ashwin pitches this one short. Afridi goes for a wild slog and thoguh he gets this off the very bottom of the bat, it clears the man at the deep extra cover boundary!

goes again and he has cleared the long-on boundary! Afridi has won it for Pakistan! This was off a leading edge, it looked like it was going to be swallowed at long-on but Afridi's power takes this over the ropes. And to make this even more memorable, he inadvertently kisses Junaid Khan on the cheek!
